function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Wildlife 'reclaiming' urban space, potentially bringing human and animal interaction that increases the risk of zoonotic diseases spreading to urban populations.","Impact":"Increased risk of zoonotic disease spread and potential outbreaks in urban areas.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to reduce human-wildlife interaction and enhance disease surveillance in urban wildlife.","Technologies":"Surveillance technologies, urban planning strategies, public health interventions.","People":"Urban residents, wildlife, public health officials.","Owner":"Local authorities, urban planners, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Increased reliance on domestic manufacturing and shorter supply chains may reconfigure the highly emissions-intensive maritime transportation sector, potentially leading to localized outbreaks of contagious diseases in manufacturing facilities.","Impact":"Localized outbreaks of contagious diseases in manufacturing facilities due to increased production and transportation activities.","Mitigation":"Enhance workplace hygiene and safety measures, implement rapid testing and contact tracing protocols, promote remote work where feasible.","Technologies":"Health monitoring technologies, workplace safety equipment, remote work infrastructure.","People":"Manufacturing workers, supply chain workers, public health authorities.","Owner":"Manufacturing companies, supply chain managers, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Suspension of environmental pollution laws and expansion of fossil fuel extractive industries may lead to increased air and water pollution, contributing to respiratory illnesses and environmental degradation.","Impact":"Increased air and water pollution, leading to respiratory illnesses and ecosystem damage.","Mitigation":"Enforce existing environmental regulations, invest in renewable energy solutions, enhance monitoring and reporting of pollution levels.","Technologies":"Air and water quality monitoring technologies, renewable energy technologies, pollution control systems.","People":"Local communities, environmental advocates, public health agencies.","Owner":"Environmental regulatory agencies, renewable energy companies, public health authorities."}]}
